list_definition.definition: the joint where the arm bends

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He leant forward on his elbows.
He elbowed his way through the crowd.

list_ex_of_english: The police sat on their elbows and said that it was nothing to do with them—it was not a breach of the peace.
Newspapers and magazines should not be burdened by high postal charges, either, and thus elbowed out of the market.
The safety precautions there are thick rubber gloves reaching to the elbows, and goggles.
The safest thing to do is to touch elbows.
There is the same pace of argument, the same stylish footwork, the same skilful use of the elbows.
People are having their ankles and elbows blown off.
Of course, they fight for more money—they use their sharp elbows to try to achieve that end—but, in my experience, that has always been a successful and good relationship.
The replacement of joints—not just hips but ankles, knees, elbows and wrists—is now possible but the operations cost a great deal.
